title: 110_s3063
content: The Act may be cited as the "S Corporation Modernization Act of 2008" and includes a reduced recognition period for built-in gains. The "S Corporation Modernization Act of 2008" includes an amendment to reduce the recognition period for built-in gains to a 7-year period starting from the 1st day of the 1st taxable year as an S corporation. This change applies to determining recognition periods before, on, or after January 1, 2008. The "S Corporation Modernization Act of 2008" reduces the recognition period for built-in gains to a 7-year period starting from the 1st day of the 1st taxable year as an S corporation. This change applies to determining recognition periods before, on, or after January 1, 2008, but does not apply for calculating the tax imposed by section 1374 of the Internal Revenue Code for taxable years ending before that date. SEC. 3 amends the termination rules for excessive passive investment income, effective for taxable years after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4 introduces modifications to passive income rules. SEC. 3 amends the termination rules for excessive passive investment income, effective for taxable years after December 31, 2007. The amendment increases the limit from 25 percent to 60 percent for the tax imposed when passive investment income of a corporation with accumulated earnings and profits exceeds a certain threshold. Conforming amendments are made to various sections to reflect this change. Subchapter S of chapter 1 is amended to increase the limit from 25 percent to 60 percent for the tax imposed on passive investment income of a corporation with accumulated earnings and profits. These amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5 expands qualifying beneficiaries of an electing small business trust by amending section 1361(c)(2)(B). The look-through rule is not applicable for subsection (b)(1)(C). Effective January 1, 2008. SEC. 6 expands S corporation eligible shareholders to include IRAs. In General, a trust constituting an individual retirement account under section 408(a) is permitted as a shareholder. Sale of stock in an IRA related to an S Corporation election is exempt from prohibited transaction rules if sold to the individual for whom the account is established. The amendments allow for the sale of stock in an IRA related to an S Corporation election under certain conditions, including fair market value sale, no payment of commissions, costs, or expenses, and a single transaction for cash within 120 days. Effective January 1, 2008. SEC. 7 allows for a deduction for charitable contributions for electing small business trusts without regard to certain limitations. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2007.
